intro: Valeriana mandonii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley valerian, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has aromatic leaves and is often found in moist meadows and along streambanks. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties. Valeriana mandonii is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
